page.title: 08AN EVENT IN DUNSBY
page.content: {Dunsby has developed its own fund {raising effort for the Church-The Walk {About Lunch.}A Sunday in midsummer is chosen and,at noon,everyone collects at The Grange for sherry and tit-bits. The next move is to The Old Rectory, where the main course is served.This consists of a variety of cold meats, salads and new potatoes.A wander down Fen Lane brings the gathering to a galaxy of sweets at The White House. Finally,coffee is served in the village hall.Later,in the afternoon, a special service is held in the church, with tea and biscuits afterwards to finish off a very pleasant day out. Tickets,at Â£3.50,are considered very good value and are much sought after by outsiders who enjoy visiting this small,close-knit community.{In 1985, {this village of 107 people raised {almost Â£400 with this event.
